Object.Field:
COMPONENT NAME: RKM Oracle Olap (Jython) COMPONENT VERSION: 10.1.3.1 AUTHOR: Oracle COMPATIBILITY: ODI 10.1.3.5.0 and above
DESCRIPTION - Reverse Knowledge Module (Jython) - Reverse engineering Knowledge Module to retrieve the tables, views, columns, Primary Keys, Unique Keys and Foreign keys from Oracle Database. - Retreive all tables using by a Rolap Cube or a Molap Cube - This KM provides logging (Use Log & Log File Name) options.
REQUIREMENTS Import this knowledge module in one of your projects. Create a model, and choose the reverse context as well as the knowledge module in the "reverse" tab. Execute the reverse engineering and follow up the steps in the logs
BASIC CONFIGURATION This RKM use AWXML.jar api provided by Oracle. You will find it in ORACLE_HOME/olap/api/lib or in www.oracle.com => Copy this API in Oracledi/drivers
OPTIONS (Refer to Option descriptions for more information on each option) MOLAP : Choose "YES" if you want to reverse a Analytic Workspace AW_NAME : Analytical Workspace Name AW_URL : Analytical Workspace Url AW_OWNER : Analytical Workspace Owner AW_PASSWORD : Analytical Workspace Owner Password ROLAP Choose : "YES" if you want to reverse tables from a ROLAP schema USE_LOG : Set to Yes if you want the reverse-engineering process log details in a log file. LOG_FILE_NAME : Log File Name.
LIMITATIONS This RKM doesn't work for an Analytical Workspace on Oracle 11g

Choose "YES" if you want to reverse a Analytic Workspace
Depending on the nature of your data you can choose either "ROLAP" if you store your data relationally (known as relational OLAP, or "ROLAP") or "MOLAP" for multi-dimensionally (multidimensional OLAP, or "MOLAP")

Analytical Workspace Url
If your jdbc connexion is jdbc:oracle:thin:@<server>:1521:<SID>
the url should be: <server>:1521:<SID>
reverse tables from a ROLAP schema

Choose "YES" if you want to reverse tables from a ROLAP schema
Depending on the nature of your data you can choose either "ROLAP" if you store your data relationally (known as relational OLAP, or "ROLAP") or "MOLAP" for multi-dimensionally (multidimensional OLAP, or "MOLAP")
Set to Yes if you want the reverse-engineering process log details in a log file.

selCol = ''' SELECT C.TABLE_NAME TABLE_NAME, C.COLUMN_NAME COL_NAME, C.DATA_TYPE DT_DRIVER, SUBSTR(CC.COMMENTS,1,250) COL_DESC, C.COLUMN_ID POS, DECODE(C.DATA_TYPE, 'NUMBER', C.DATA_PRECISION, NVL(C.DATA_PRECISION,C.DATA_LENGTH)) LONGC, C.DATA_SCALE SCALEC, DECODE(C.NULLABLE,'Y','0','1') COL_MANDATORY FROM ALL_TAB_COLUMNS C, ALL_COL_COMMENTS CC WHERE C.OWNER = ? AND C.TABLE_NAME = ? AND CC.OWNER(+) = C.OWNER AND CC.TABLE_NAME(+) = C.TABLE_NAME AND CC.COLUMN_NAME(+) = C.COLUMN_NAME '''
insCol = '''insert into SNP_REV_COL ( I_MOD, TABLE_NAME, COL_NAME, DT_DRIVER, COL_DESC, POS, LONGC, SCALEC, COL_MANDATORY, CHECK_STAT, CHECK_FLOW ) values ( /*I_MOD*/ <%=snpRef.getModel("ID")%>, /*TABLE_NAME*/ ?, /*COL_NAME*/ ?, /*DT_DRIVER*/ ?, /*COL_DESC*/ ?, /*POS*/ ?, /*LONGC*/ ?, /*SCALEC*/ ?, /*COL_MANDATORY*/ ?, /*CHECK_STAT*/ '1', /*CHECK_FLOW*/ '1' ) '''
stCol = srcCx.prepareStatement (selCol) ps = trgCx.prepareStatement(insCol)
for tables in tableLst: recordLog ("Reverse Table or view %s " %tables) nbTables +=1 stCol.clearParameters() stCol.setString(1,srcUser); stCol.setString(2,tables); rsCol = stCol.executeQuery() while rsCol.next(): recordLog( "\t"+rsCol.getString("COL_NAME")) nbColumns +=1 ps.clearParameters() ps.setString(1, rsCol.getString("TABLE_NAME")) ps.setString(2,rsCol.getString("COL_NAME")) ps.setString(3,rsCol.getString("DT_DRIVER")) ps.setString(4,rsCol.getString("COL_NAME")) ps.setInt(5,rsCol.getInt("POS")) ps.setInt(6,rsCol.getInt("LONGC")) ps.setInt(7,rsCol.getInt("SCALEC")) ps.setString(8,rsCol.getString("COL_MANDATORY")) ps.executeUpdate()
rsCol.close(); ps.close() stCol.close();

import java.sql as sql import java.lang as lang import time
def recordLog(rec): if uselog: t = time.localtime() l = '%d-%02d-%02d %02d:%02d:%02d - %s' % (t[0], t[1], t[2], t[3], t[4], t[5], rec) f = open(logfilename, "a+") print >> f, l f.close() print l
logfilename = r'<%=odiRef.getOption("LOG_FILE_NAME")%>' uselog = <%=odiRef.getOption("USE_LOG")%> if uselog: f = open(logfilename, "w") f.close()
query=" select to_char(null) owner, to_char(null) table_name, null olap_type from dual where 1=2 "; tableDic ={} tableLst = []
srcCx = odiRef.getJDBCConnection("SRC") trgCx = odiRef.getJDBCConnection("DEST")
srcUser = '<%=odiRef.getModel("SCHEMA_NAME")%>' srcAlias = '<%=odiRef.getModel("REV_ALIAS_LTRIM")%>' srcObjPatt = '<%=odiRef.getModel("REV_OBJ_PATT")%>' if len(srcObjPatt)==0: srcObjPatt = "%"
recordLog( "Starting the Molap and Rolap reverse Table ")
recordLog( "\t%s.%s = %s.%s" %("ABC","FK_COL_NAME","PK_TABLE_NAME","PK_COL_NAME")) nbTables =0 nbColumns = 0 nbKeys = 0 nbFkeys = 0

RolapTable = '''select distinct L.LEVEL_TABLE_OWNER||'.'||L.LEVEL_TABLE_NAME TABLE_NAME, 'DI' OLAP_TYPE from olapsys.all$OLAP_DIM_LEVELS L, olapsys.ALL$OLAP_CUBE_DIM_USES CD where CD.DIMENSION_NAME = L.DIMENSION_NAME and CD.DIMENSION_OWNER = L.OWNER and L.LEVEL_TABLE_OWNER = ? union select distinct FACT_TABLE_OWNER||'.'||FACT_TABLE_NAME TABLE_NAME, 'FA' from olapsys.ALL$OLAP_CUBE_MEASURE_MAPS where FACT_TABLE_OWNER = ?'''
rstmt = srcCx.prepareStatement (RolapTable) rstmt.clearParameters() rstmt.setString(1,srcUser) rstmt.setString(2,srcUser) rlst = rstmt.executeQuery() while rlst.next(): tname = rlst.getString("TABLE_NAME") if (tableDic.has_key(tname)==0): tableDic[tname]=rlst.getString("OLAP_TYPE"); rlst.close();

qryMore = "" for key,value in tableDic.items(): owner = key.split(".")[0]
tname = key.split(".")[1] olaptype = value qryMore = qryMore+ "union all select '%s','%s','%s' from dual " %(owner,tname,olaptype);
stmt =''' SELECT TABLESYS.TABLE_NAME, TABLESYS.RES_NAME, TABLESYS.TABLE_ALIAS, TABLESYS.REMARKS, TABLESYS.TABLE_TYPE , TABLESYS.R_COUNT, TUNION.OLAP_TYPE FROM ( SELECT T.OWNER OWNER, T.TABLE_NAME TABLE_NAME, T.TABLE_NAME RES_NAME, SUBSTR(REPLACE(T.TABLE_NAME,?,''),1,35) TABLE_ALIAS, SUBSTR(TC.COMMENTS,1,250) REMARKS, 'T' TABLE_TYPE, T.NUM_ROWS R_COUNT FROM ALL_TABLES T, ALL_TAB_COMMENTS TC WHERE T.OWNER = ? AND T.TABLE_NAME LIKE ? AND TC.OWNER(+) = T.OWNER AND TC.TABLE_NAME(+) = T.TABLE_NAME UNION SELECT V.OWNER , V.VIEW_NAME, V.VIEW_NAME, SUBSTR(REPLACE(V.VIEW_NAME,?,''),1,35), SUBSTR(VC.COMMENTS,1,250), 'V', 0 FROM ALL_VIEWS V, ALL_TAB_COMMENTS VC, ALL_OBJECTS O WHERE V.OWNER = ? AND V.VIEW_NAME LIKE ? AND VC.OWNER(+) = V.OWNER AND VC.TABLE_NAME(+) = V.VIEW_NAME AND O.OWNER = V.OWNER AND O.OBJECT_NAME = V.VIEW_NAME) TABLESYS ,( %s %s ) TUNION WHERE TUNION.TABLE_NAME = TABLESYS.TABLE_NAME AND TUNION.OWNER = TABLESYS.OWNER ''' %(query,qryMore)
print
insTable = '''insert into SNP_REV_TABLE (I_MOD,TABLE_NAME,RES_NAME,TABLE_ALIAS,TABLE_DESC,R_COUNT,TABLE_TYPE,OLAP_TYPE,IND_SHOW) values (?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,'1')'''
stTable = srcCx.prepareStatement(stmt); stTable.clearParameters()
stTable.setString(1,srcAlias) stTable.setString(2,srcUser) stTable.setString(3,srcObjPatt) stTable.setString(4,srcAlias) stTable.setString(5,srcUser) stTable.setString(6,srcObjPatt) rsTable = stTable.executeQuery()
ps = trgCx.prepareStatement(insTable)
while rsTable.next(): tableLst = tableLst+[rsTable.getString("TABLE_NAME")] ps.clearParameters() ps.setInt(1,<%=snpRef.getModel("ID")%>) ps.setString(2,rsTable.getString("TABLE_NAME")) ps.setString(3,rsTable.getString("RES_NAME")) ps.setString(4,rsTable.getString("TABLE_ALIAS")) ps.setString(5,rsTable.getString("REMARKS")) ps.setInt(6,rsTable.getInt("R_COUNT")) ps.setString(7,rsTable.getString("TABLE_TYPE")) ps.setString(8,rsTable.getString("OLAP_TYPE")) ps.executeUpdate() ps.close() rsTable.close(); stTable.close();
